election_record.label: Vermont 1823 Governor

overview.note: The Official Results list Cornelius P. Van Ness with 11479 votes, Dudley Chase with 1088 votes, Charles K. Williams with 182 votes, Elias Keyes with 118 votes and Henry Olin with 58 votes but the county totals add up to 11428 for Van Ness, 1093 for Chase, 184 for Williams, 120 for Keyes and 96 for Olin.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: The Official Results list Cornelius P. Van Ness with 1367 votes but the town totals add up to 1367.

sub_unit.name: Addison
sub_unit.note: Cornelius P. Van Ness received 1 vote as C. Van Ness.

sub_unit.name: Chittenden
sub_unit.note: The Official Results list Cornelius P. Van Ness with 906 votes but the town totals add up to 907.

sub_unit.name: Granby
sub_unit.note: The votes from Granby were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Franklin
sub_unit.note: The Official Results list Cornelius P. Van Ness with 696 votes and Dudley Chase with 344 votes but the town totals add up to 700 for Van Ness and 350 for Chase.
Charles Marsh received 18 votes as C. Marsh

sub_unit.name: Belvidere
sub_unit.note: The votes from Belvidere were rejected.

sub_unit.name: Orange
sub_unit.note: The Official Results list Cornelius P. Van Ness with 1129 votes but the town totals add up to 1130.

sub_unit.name: Coventry
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Coventry.

sub_unit.name: Eden
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Eden.

sub_unit.name: Rutland
sub_unit.note: The Official Results list Cornelius P. Van Ness with 1589 votes but the town totals add up to 1599.

sub_unit.name: Berlin
sub_unit.note: There were no votes cast in Berlin.

sub_unit.name: Dover
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Dover.

sub_unit.name: Windsor
sub_unit.note: The Official Results list Cornelius P. Van Ness with 1671 votes but the town totals add up to 1671 votes.

sub_unit.name: Baltimore
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Baltimore.

sub_unit.name: Norwich
sub_unit.note: There were no votes recorded in Norwich.

election_record.reference: Original Election Returns. Vermont State Archives, Middlesex.
Woodstock Observer (Woodstock, VT), and Windsor and Orange County Gazette (Woodstock, VT). October 14, 1823.
Fairbanks, Edward Taylor. The Town of St. Johnsbury VT: a review of one hundred and twenty-five years to the anniversary pageant 1912. St. Johnsbury, VT: The Cowles Press, 1914. 571.
